sub_title: DXP consultancy | digital service analysis & design | digital project & product management
summary: New digital services and platforms to enable and improve marketing, business, commerce, publishing, or education are my specialty. I analyze, specify, compose, and design online services and platforms. And I define and  coordinate programs, projects, and teams to deliver these digital services to customers and users.

courses.name: Project management  with  MS Team Foundation System
Value Requirements.Defining stakeholder values and product qualities

profile_positions.description:
Dept Technology was integrated into a larger business unit in January 2021 and evaporated in Dept's corporate cloud. So I left Dept Agency. I am currently working as a business analyst, service designer and product owner for iDA. 

iDA is a Belgian/Dutch digital experience platform (DXP) services provider focused on digital content management and marketing solutions. As an Adobe Solution Partner, iDA delivers Adobe Experience Cloud based DXP development, maintenance and operations services to customers in Benelux countries.
profile_positions.title: Business analyst/service designer & product owner

profile_positions.description:
Dept Agency is a worldwide digital agency. Tricode was acquired by Dept in 2017 and renamed "Dept Technology" in 2018. 

Same work, different name: at Dept Technology, I was still doing DXP solution consultancy, bid & project management, service & interaction design etc. for the development of B2C and B2B digital experience and ecommerce platform solutions. 

DXP solutions delivered by Dept Technology projects I was involved in were made using Magnolia CMS or Adobe Experience Manager (content management), CommerceTools  (e-commerce), Apache SOLR (search) and auxiliary SAAS solutions and systems integrations.
profile_positions.title: Solution consultant & project manager

profile_positions.description:
Worked as a  business & solution consultant/analyst, bid/project/service manager, Scrum master & product owner, digital & IT services designer for this Dutch/North-Macedonian IT services provider for +7 years. 

Tricode provided software development, maintenance and hosting services of digital experience,  e-commerce and  e-business solutions. These solutions were built in Magnolia CMS or Adobe Experience  Manager (content management),  Intershop or CommerceTools (e-commerce), or as bespoke Java apps (e-business).
profile_positions.title: Solution consultant & project manager

profile_positions.description:
I worked for the Software Development & Maintenance Center (SDMC) software factory of Atos Origin Benelux as a project manager on outsourced web development projects.  The SDMC work consisted of coordination of (sometimes agile and offshored) web portal development projects for multinational tech companies and Dutch governmental organizations. 

Methodologies used were Prince2 and agile principles tailored to (offshored) software factory work processes. Technologies used were MS.NET, MS Sharepoint and Java.
profile_positions.title: Project manager

profile_positions.description:
From 2001 to 2008 I worked as a project/product/delivery/bid manager, business & solution (presales) consultant, business analyst and software designer for business units of both Centric Software Engineering (custom software solutions) and Centric IT Solutions (software products) . 

For Centric Professional Services I was implementation project manager of a eHRM portal SAAS solution for Centric HR departments.
profile_positions.title: Centric Professional Services - Project manager

profile_positions.description:
After almost 2 years of portal product development, I became a project manager/consultant at Centric Software Engineering (a.k.a. Centric e-Technology): this meant coordination of bespoke MS.NET web app development and MS Sharepoint portal implementation projects. And a lot of (presales) solution consultancy and bid management for software project acquisition. 

Keywords:  B2C e-commerce solutions for the travel industry, Sharepoint intranet/extranet portal solutions, Web4All CMS.
profile_positions.title: Centric Software Engineering - Project manager/consultant

profile_positions.description: Centric sent me to Gouda to be a product development project manager at the Real Estate unit of Centric IT Solutions: project (team) management of two development projects of self service portal products.  These web portal products were developed upon Centric mid and back office products for the Dutch real estate/housing and car leasing markets.
profile_positions.title: Centric IT Solutions - Project manager

profile_positions.description:
Resources and projects of Centric KSI were integrated into Centric Information Engineering (CIE) in 2002. So I did project management, software requirements engineering and design work in website development projects of CIE. 

Also did e-business, e-learning and ECM related consultancy assignments and  presales work for software development project acquisition. And I made version 1.0 of Centric's MS .NET software development guidelines while working for CIE.
profile_positions.title: Centric Information Engineering - Solution consultant & project manager

profile_positions.description:
Davilex was a  victim of the burst of the "internet bubble" in 2001: I became a solution consultant and project manager at Centric KSI. This meant software platform product and project management, solution consultancy, analysis and design for development of online e-learning and employee support solutions. 

Middleware (micro)services, AICC, SCORM,  Electronic Performance Support Systems (EPSS) and on-demand web based learning were the keywords of this game.
profile_positions.title: Centric KSI - Solution consultant & project/product manager

profile_positions.description:
Print publishers  were deaf, dumb and blind to the emergence of the web in '94/95, so I joined  PC consumer software and games publisher Davilex Software. I started as an allround "webmaster" by designing, developing and managing their websites, webshops and online extensions of consumer and educational software products and PC games. 

Worked as a webdev lead  in their website products team and consumer software R&D team later on. D2C web shops, product and community sites, streaming media, online highscore competitions and customer support tools: all built using my "own" Perl based web content management (WCM) toolkit.
profile_positions.title: Internet project lead & tech lead

profile_positions.description: I made (designed, developed and wrote) PC multimedia business newsletters for 3.5" floppy disk and CDRom, when the Web brought hypertext and graphic design to the internet. I morphed the offline digital newsletters into fancy websites and tried to convince publishers that this would become the NEXT BIG THING in (digital) publishing.
profile_positions.title: Multimedia/web designer & developer

profile_positions.description: I had several non-internet related publishing  and  information/data research jobs in the late '80's and beginning of the '90's, involving  copy writing and editing, desktop publishing (DTP), computer aided research & reporting (CARR) and GIS  & car navigation database development.
profile_positions.title: Several print & digital publishing jobs
